Detailed Description

Interrupt handling base class.

Class Gate is the superclass of a set of classes that are able to handle interrupts. Every subclass of Gate has to implement method trigger() that implements the appropriated behavior of the handler.

Member Function Documentation

virtual void Gate::epilogue (  )  [pure virtual]

schedulable part of interrupt handling

Just as method prologue() it has to be implemented in the subclasses of Gate.

Implemented in Keyboard, and Panic.

virtual bool Gate::prologue (  )  [pure virtual]

Immediate part of interrupt handling.

To enalbe different behavior according to the occured interrupt this method has to be implemented in subclasses of Gate.

Returns:
TRUE if method epilogue() has to be executed afterwards.

Implemented in Keyboard, and Panic.
